prompt: Green algae bloom after two weeks with live plants. I don't want to use copper.

render.overview: Algae blooms are common in young planted tanks. We’ll trim light and nutrients without risky chemicals.
likely_causes: Excess light duration for a new tank
Nutrient imbalance (high nitrate, low competition from plants)
fix_steps: Reduce photoperiod to 6–8 hours; keep a strict timer.
Manual remove: swirl and net floating clumps; wipe glass.
Add fast growers (hornwort, floaters) to soak up nutrients.
Weekly 25% water change until nitrate stays <20 ppm.
prevention: Gradually increase light after 4–6 weeks if plants demand it.
Avoid overfeeding; keep stable CO2 from good surface agitation.
Test nitrate weekly and trim plants to maintain growth.
